question:
An MoU has been signed between GeM (Government e-Marketplace) and SIDBI (Small Industries Development Bank of India) to promote Womainya and Start-Up Runway initiatives. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Womaniya initiative allows government ministries to procure goods directly from women entrepreneurs.
  2. The Start-Up Runway allows government buyers to procure goods directly from entrepreneurs.
  Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Womaniya initiative was launched by GeM early in 2019 to benefit women entrepreneurs. It allows them to sell products directly to government departments, ministries, institutions etc. The initiative will see the webpage informing procurement officers in state bodies about their products like office furniture, handicrafts, jute and coir products, etc. Statement 2 is correct: The Start-Up Runway was launched by GeM and Start-Up India to link registered startups with government buyers. This will increase their visibility and marketing. The initiative allows startups to run market trials with state buyers and also get timely feedback on comparison of product quality, price, market valuation, etc.
